channel.title: Allocate more memory for workstation
channel.description:
Hey there.
I just installed Whomix via KVM. Everything runs fine but it seems that my workstations is a bit slowly. So i checked how many ram is allocated to it. Its just 1GB. Since my host has much more, I would like to use more.
If I try to allocate more via the Virtual Machine Manager gui it tells me: Angeforderte Operation ist nicht gültig: Kann nicht die Größe des maximalen Speichers auf einer aktiven Domain ändern
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/share/virt-manager/virtManager/details.py", line 2326, in _change_config_helper self.vm.hotplug(**hotplug_args) File "/usr/share/virt-manager/virtManager/domain.py", line 986, in hotplug _hotplug_maxmem(maxmem) File "/usr/share/virt-manager/virtManager/domain.py", line 960, in _hotplug_maxmem self._backend.setMaxMemory(val) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/libvirt.py", line 2180, in setMaxMemory if ret == -1: raise libvirtError ('virDomainSetMaxMemory() failed', dom=self) libvirtError: Angeforderte Operation ist nicht gültig: Kann nicht die Größe des maximalen Speichers auf einer aktiven Domain ändern
How can I change the allocated memory for my Workstation?

item.title: Allocate more memory for workstation
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
You can change it by going to virt-manager -> Whonix-Workstation settings -> Memory -> raise limt from 1024 to 2048 mb

item.title: Allocate more memory for workstation
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

please regard this: Kvm + whonix 11 slowness

At the moment, adding more memory doesn’t impact performance beneficially, as any slowness is sadly a result of the virtualized graphics united, which can’t be improved upon at current times.

Have a nice day,

Ego
